revised_title: Freeze-Fracture Evidence for Sequential Membrane Assembly in Developing Axons
tldr: The study examines the membrane structure of vesiculotubular complexes in developing axons of rat optic nerves using freeze-fracture electron microscopy. The results show that these complexes have a different membrane structure than the axolemma, suggesting a sequential mode of membrane development where a relatively undifferentiated membrane bilayer is followed by the insertion of specialized proteins within specific membrane domains.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
